channel.title: Chattanooga, TN claims fastest internet in U.S
channel.description:
The unlikely city of Chattanooga says it began offering one-gigabit-per-second internet upload and download speeds Monday, a rate it says is the fastest in the United States -- and 250 times the average internet speed in the nation. The city says the move is an investment in the future. "It's like any other leading technology, people will invent ways to use it," said Ron Littlefield, mayor of the city of 170,000. "And having it here will bring those inventive minds to focus in Chattanooga." The faster speeds won't come cheap, however. EPB, the city-owned power company offering the one-gig speeds, will charge about $350 per month for the ultra-fast service.
http://www.cnn.com/2010/TECH/innovation/09/13/chattanooga.broadband/index.html?hpt=Sbin

<3 Australian internet
[/quote]

Enjoy limited connection, and no L4D.[/quote]
Clearly it was sarcasm. Australia’s internet sucks. Although apparently with this new National Broadband Network we’ll have 100x faster internet. BUTTTTTTT I highly doubt it.
